workAuthorization.status: Authorized to work in the US for any employer

truthfulnessPolicy: Do not claim tools/tech not demonstrated in repos or deployed apps.
Quantified metrics must be tied to evidence notes.
Unknown dates remain null until confirmed.

frontend.headline: Junior Frontend Developer (React) • React (Vite) • Accessibility-first UI • API-integrated apps
frontend.summary_short: I’m an early-career full-stack developer who learns fast and proves it by shipping. I build API-first apps with React (Vite) focused on clear UX, accessibility, and maintainable code.
frontend.summary_long: I’m an early-career full-stack developer who learns fast and proves it by shipping. If your team uses a framework, library, or language I haven’t used yet, I’m ready to learn it and get productive quickly. I have solid web fundamentals (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) and I build API-first apps with React (Vite) on the frontend and FastAPI/Express on the backend—focused on clear UX, accessibility, and maintainable code. I’ve deployed full-stack projects and worked through real production issues (CORS, environment variables, API routing) to keep integrations stable.

If your team uses a framework, library, or language I haven’t used yet, I’m ready to learn it and get productive quickly. I have solid web fundamentals (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) and I build API-first apps with React (Vite) on the frontend and FastAPI/Express on the backend—focused on clear UX, accessibility, and maintainable code. highlights: Shipped deployed full-stack applications and resolved production integration issues (CORS/env/API routing).
Builds accessible, responsive React UIs with clear state/data flow and user-focused error handling.
API-first mindset: consistent contracts, structured responses, and maintainable code organization.

projects.name: NFL Prediction Platform
impactBullets: Built a FastAPI prediction service that loads versioned model bundles (joblib) and returns structured, user-friendly prediction responses consumed by a React frontend.

Implemented leak-safe, time-aware evaluation and probability calibration; tracked score accuracy (MAE/RMSE) and win probability quality (ROC AUC, Brier).(beginner level but have acheived training some solid models for sports predictions)
Improved production reliability by debugging and resolving cross-environment deployment issues (CORS configuration, environment variables, and API routing) to keep the React↔API integration stable.
Enhanced developer experience with consistent API contracts, structured errors, and reproducible dataset/versioning habits to reduce training/inference drift.

modelMetrics.context: win probability baseline. What it measures: how well a binary classifier ranks positives above negatives across all thresholds. Think: “If I pick one random positive case and one random negative case, how often does the model give the positive a higher score?” AUC = 0.5 → random guessing, AUC = 1.0 → perfect ranking
modelMetrics.note: From baseline training/eval run; keep updated if you publish a new benchmark.

modelMetrics.context: calibrated probability baseline. What it measures: average squared difference between predicted probabilities and actual outcomes. Think: “If I predicted 70% probability 100 times, how far off were those predictions on average?” Brier = 0.0 → perfect calibration, Brier = 1.0 → worst possible calibration
modelMetrics.note: Lower is better from 0.0 - 1.0; indicates in this case ptediction/probability quality (calibration + accuracy).

engineeringProof.note: Demonstrated through deployed app behavior and deployment troubleshooting work.

projects.name: CodeArchive (CodeArch)
impactBullets: Built a React single-page app for saving, tagging, versioning, and exporting code snippets for fast reuse.
Designed import/export flows and a sandbox preview concept so stored snippets are immediately practical, not just archived.
Focused on clear component structure, readable UI, and accessibility-friendly styling to support real developer workflows.

productSignals.claim: Low-friction snippet reuse via search + export
productSignals.note: Backed by repo features and UI flow design (import/export/preview).

bullets: Built and shipped React (Vite) apps with a front-end focus—responsive, accessible UI, clean component structure, routing, and reliable API integration using strong HTML/CSS/JavaScript fundamentals.

Built and consumed REST APIs with FastAPI/Node (Express), using JSON contracts, validation/error handling, and production deployment troubleshooting (Git workflow, CORS, environment variables, API routing) to keep frontend↔backend integrations stable.
translation_to_dev: Frontend focus → Crafting high-performance, accessible user interfaces with modern React practices.
Full-stack stability → Bridging the gap between frontend and backend with robust API design and deployment expertise.

bullets: Drove a 7% increase in monthly sales by diagnosing customer needs and recommending tailored solutions.
Managed cash and high-value transactions with 100% accuracy while maintaining policy compliance.
Implemented a customer feedback process that reduced complaints by 15% and improved repeat business.
Trained and mentored 5 new team members on POS workflows and service standards, improving onboarding efficiency by 20%.
Partnered with inventory and marketing to align product displays with seasonal promotions, boosting foot traffic by 10%.
translation_to_dev: User-first communication → clearer UI copy, fewer UX dead-ends, better troubleshooting.
High-trust handling → careful attention to correctness and edge cases.

bullets: Strengthened problem-solving and quality control in a high-velocity environment; communicated clearly across teams under time constraints.
